ratings.comment: Please do not take this course. I wish I had a former student warn me prior to enrolling in it. There is no clear grading rubric/criteria for ANY assignment. An A is almost unattainable. All assigned novels MUST BE read and purchased or you will fail no questions asked. He does not accommodate students whatsoever. Quite rude and sarcastic as well.

Just dropped this professor's class. Honestly, He is the worst professor I have ever encountered in the 3 years I have been in college. Imagine learning a new language and then having someone laugh and stare in the most judgmental manner. He made me afraid to speak in class because if it was not how he wanted you would be embarrassed. DON'T TAKE!
Pretentious Professor with a chip on his shoulder. Just take someone else's class. Don't Sacrifice your money or GPA.
He is one of the worst professors I have ever had in French. He is very critical and rude. Take this class with a different instructor.

He seems extremely intimidating at first and in some ways he is. However, I found him to be the best TA I've had thus far. He has expectations but if you follow them you'll be fine. He's not that harsh of a grader and you will know your grammar cold when you're done. Also, he likes to do optional activities out of class which was fun!

Yoassi is difficult, but not in the way everyone seems to think he is. Show up to every class, and dumbly follow his suggestions, and you will be fine. He can be a bit harsh, but not unprofessional. I did not find his expectations unreasonable whatsoever. He knows his stuff extremely well, you just have to look past him being "mean".
unprofessional behavior towards female students on occasion, inside and outside of the classroom
The rudest professor I have ever encountered.  A total jerk.

Horrible professor, completely turned me off to taking another French class. He was rude and condescending, was not helpful/able to meet with students out of class and was unclear about what was expected on homework/exams etc. Avoid him if you can.

Yoassi is very strict and intimidating, true.. he's a fair grader though, and will definitely improve your grammar and pronunciation. If you're planning on being a French major, I definitely recommend his classes. If you're getting retro credits and just need to pass.. find another section. To win him over/get an A, just speak up a lot in class.

This class is NOT an easy class, but I found that my grade was heavily influenced by the amount of effort I put into it. Tresor expects his students to be adults. This means that he expects everyone to participate in class, read the material, and do the work. This professor wants his students to look at more than just the surface. + sense of humor.

Tresor may appear intimidating at first but his heart is in the right place and just wants to push his students to succeed. Don't be a wallflower and actually make yourself noticeable in the class by participating... you'll be surprised at how much this can impact your grade!

Most of the people in my class found him to be extremely intimidating and demanding but as the semester went on I found him to be a very nice and funny guy. If you make it known you're genuinely interested in the class and learning the material he is very approachable. Literature is a bit demanding but interesting if that's what you're into.
Awful instructor.

Pretty accurate ratings here.  He is intimidating and tough.  He's not a "fun" teacher, but you WILL know your stuff when you're done.  If you are taking French to make crèpes and sing songs, he may not be for you.  But if you want to learn your grammar cold, he's a very good teacher.  Nice guy outside of class, as noted.

Tresor has high expectations of his students and can be intimidating at times but he is a very knowledgable teacher and he doesn't grade too hard. If you are interested in learning french and intend to put some effort into the class, I would recommend his class. As long as he knows you're trying, you can get a good grade.

So Tresor may seem scary and ridiculous and i'm not going to lie most of the time i had no idea what he wanted from me, but although he's scary, if you talk to him, he'll be nice. his accent is hard to get used to at first, but hey, he's better than Nabil Khwala.. overall i'd say that you're better off after the class
No Comments

Power-trip? maybe. It's really easy to be frustrated with him because he doesn't always do a great job of explaining what he wants done. Very strict, but a nice guy if you get to know him a bit. He's a pretty easy grader, but his criticism can be a little intimidating. I thought the class was entertaining and interesting for the most part.
This TA was on a ridiculous power trip.  Seeing him outside of class is absolutely worthless.
